instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 00840 no video
threads.message: the macbook turns on , fan spins, click on keyboard, cpu gets hot. but i dont have any video on display. where do i start to to check?.

threads.title: 820 00840 no video
threads.message:
First confirm USB activity.
Also check for external video.
Any history, liquid damage?

threads.title: 820 00840 no video
threads.message: already tested for usb activity, a connected mouse, blinks once and thats all. ill check for external video. no idea what happened, but i can see some green stuff at wifi controller.

threads.title: 820 00840 no video
threads.message: well ive checked for external video and nothing. so no usb activity. it seems water damaged, corrosion at backlight caps and tripped water seals. ive cleaned the corrosion but the issue persist: cpu gets hot, fan spin, and nothing more...

threads.title: 820 00840 no video
threads.message:
Backlight caps have almost 50V and liquid there can be fatal damage for the board.
This board has no caps on the video lines and CPU dies very easy.
Sometimes only LCD video bad, but your case is worst; as you don't have USB activity even.
You can try to heat CPU with quality flux.
A small chance to be an issue generated by accumulated crap between its balls...

threads.title: 820 00840 no video
threads.message: got it, ill try that...else this is a piece of crap then?
